com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read

Class TableReaderFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.TableReaderFactory

  • public class TableReaderFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The TableReaderFactory class provides static convenience methods for creating TableReaders.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath)
      Get a table reader for the given file.
      static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath, ReaderType readerType)
      Get a table reader of the specified type corresponding to the given file.
      static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath, java.lang.String tableName)
      Get a table reader for the given file and table name.
      static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath, java.lang.String tableName, ReaderType readerType)
      Get a table reader of the specified type corresponding to the given file and table name.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getTableReader

        public static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         java.lang.String tableName,
                         ReaderType readerType)
        Get a table reader of the specified type corresponding to the given file and table name.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the data file.
        tableName - The name to use for the table.
        readerType - The type of reader to construct.
        Returns:
        a reader corresponding to the given arguments.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if fileName was not found.

      • getTableReader

        public static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         ReaderType readerType)
        Get a table reader of the specified type corresponding to the given file. The file name (excluding directories) will be used as the table name.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the data file.
        readerType - The type of reader to construct.
        Returns:
        a reader corresponding to the given arguments.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if fileName was not found.

      • getTableReader

        public static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         java.lang.String tableName)
        Get a table reader for the given file and table name. The reader type will be inferred from the file extension.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the data file.
        tableName - The name to use for the table.
        Returns:
        a reader corresponding to the given arguments.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if fileName was not found.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filePath contains no extension to determine the reader.
        TableDataException - if the reader type could not be deteremined from filePath.
        See Also:
        ReaderType.getReaderType(String)

      • getTableReader

        public static TableReader getTableReader(java.lang.String filePath)
        Get a table reader for the given file. The file name (excluding directories) will be used as the table name. The reader type will be inferred from the file extension.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the delimited data file.
        Returns:
        a reader corresponding to the given arguments.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if fileName was not found.
        TableDataException - if the reader type could not be deteremined from filePath.
        See Also:
        ReaderType.getReaderType(String)
